div.p: This element belongs within WRITING RECEPTION . It refers to the appearance of author as fictitious character in someone’s later writings - Aphra Behn as freedom fighter, Ada Byron as detective etc. (but not recasting of her works, for which use RSHEINFLUENCED). It should contain a full sentence, and any titles that occur within it should be tagged as such. It has no mandatory or optional attributes or sub-elements.
Use this element when the fictional work follows and responds to the entry subject and her work. To point backwards from her work to earlier texts, use the Intertextuality element.
<FICTIONALIZEDTREATMENT>Jane Urquhart's Changing Heaven uses a fictional composite of Emily Brontë as a character in the work.</FICTIONALIZEDTREATMENT> (This would appear in EB’s entry.)
This element differs from the influence elements because INFLUENCE is more general; this is applied specifically to one kind of response.
